pullRequest.body:
Co-authored-by: @jjaassoonn 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f808d7f204](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23216/commits/f808d7f204cdd579d00893f8bd1709e52b758b29)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coe_bot`
`+ coe_top`
`+ span_le`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I think the `_set` can be dropped here, this is arguably "the" coercion.
okay!
I would expect there to be a much shorter proof of this that appeals to the definition of `span` rather than going through the summation.

The proof starts
```
by
  rw [TwoSidedIdeal.ringCon_le_iff, RingCon.gi _ |>.gc]
```
and then the rest is pretty trivial
changed!
Do we have anything like this for the other `span` and `closure`s in mathlib?

You mean like [Finsupp.mem_ideal_span_range_iff_exists_finsupp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Ideal/Operations.html#Finsupp.mem_ideal_span_range_iff_exists_finsupp)?

Yeah, something like that. Could you maybe split `span'` and related lemmas to a new PR, since I think we want to think a little harder about consistency here, but I don't want to hold up the other lemmas.

Do you need this result, or only `span_le`?
I need this result very bad :(( it's both for tensorproduct of cantral simple and for wedderburn-artin theorem :(( so I want this in ASAP

Let's go for:
* Split this PR into the trivial and non-trivial pieces, so that we can merge at least the easy half ASAP.
* Put up (one or both of) the follow-up PRs, to see if there's a way around needing this lemma.
okay I'll do the split first
`span'` deleted!
Does `rfl` alone work for both of these? If so, I think it's preferred as it enables `dsimp`.
I also think you should move these right next to the corresponding `mem_{bot,top}` lemmas a few lines above.
changed!
Looks like you haven't (yet) pushed!
I'm checking if it builds it tends to take time to build mathlib :((
I'd recommend pushing first, assuming CI is faster than your laptop.
Probably you should put these imports back as they were
instances? I'm not sure I follow
Typo, sorry
but theses are what `#min_imports` give?

min_imports unfortunately can sometimes lie. Really though, the question for this PR is "why did the imports need to change for the new lemmas". If you believe they are somehow not minimal at master (which is certainly possible), then that's a job for a separate PR.
reverted

pullRequest.title: chore(Mathlib/RingTheory/TwoSidedIdeal/Operations): add some lemmas
